title: >>> DRAFT Results
body_text:
The DRAFT
With every professional sports season precedes the annual draft – an array of determined individuals selected to a certain team. Though the beloved game of dodgeball is not on that mainstream level, the participants of the weekly gathering always act with class and style.
For this 101st outing, the wily veterans of yester-year combined forces with some of the newest, most talented warriors to ever set foot on the dodgeball battlegrounds. These very newbies added that element of surprise to already unpredictable clash, setting the stage for one of the closest encounters in all of history.
Team ONE Draft Picks
(In Order of Selection)
:
1. Bobby Moser
3.	Christian Prima
5.	Robert Pellecchia
8.	Robert Avakian
10.	Kevin Adams
11.	Dan Turner
12.	Justin Dilts
15.	Chris Adams
16.	Gerald Lewis
Team TWO Draft Picks
(In Order of Selection)
:
2.	Mike Butler
4.	Kevin Meinert
6.	Paavo Prima
7.	Ray Marzarella
9.	Mike Edwards
13.	Kevin Megill
14.	Juan Londono
17.	John Tronolone
And the rosters didn't stopped there.
Team ONE would acquire the likes of megastar Tom Adams, court general Justin Pierce, the sensational Lauren Stopa, and the debuts of athletes like Charles "Chicky" Surmonte and Jeff Mundo.
As Team ONE added to their all-star line-up, Team TWO would include the big-mouthed veteran Diana DiBuccio, dodging icon Sascha Basista, and the catching-machine himself, Mike "Sputz" Krott. Plus, the addition of new-comer Mike Miow gave this superb squad an extra edge.
The concept may have been one thought up at the very last minute, but there isn't any doubt or question that the
Dodgeball Draft
may come back for a second go. The score itself can certainly explain why:
Team ONE victories: 2, 4, 7, 8
Team TWO victories: 1, 3, 5, 6
It doesn't get any closer than this. And so in the absence of the anticipated
CREAMation
between legends Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick, it's safe to say the inaugural
Dodgeball Draft
delivered in high fashion.
Team ONE fought Team TWO to a 4 – 4 draw at DODGEBALL 101.
Moments & Stars
: the swarm of bugs all over the court; the dominating performance from Lauren Stopa; Mike Miow's harding-hitting and ever-resilient debut
RECORDS
> Attendance: 30
> Notable Returns: Gerald Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LX3)
> New Players: (8) Bobby Moser, Mike Miow, Charles Surmonte, Justin Dilts, Christian Prima, Paavo Prima, Jeff Mundo, Kevin Meinert.
- With the super-sized
Adams/Fitzpatrick
rematch postponed, the sport witnessed the first-ever
Dodgeball Draft
where players were randomly put on either Teams ONE or TWO.
- DODGEBALL 101, along with the preceding DODGEBALL 100, are the first consecutive events with attendances of 30 or more since DODGEBALL 70 and DODGEBALL 71 in late December 2006/early January 2007, respectively.
- DODGEBALL 101 was the first event not to feature captains since DODGEBALL 97:
Wall v. All 2
.
- The famed
OH Tracks
soundtrack made a return, playing the songs that went unheard at the previous week's phenomenon, DODGEBALL 100.
DODGEBALL 102: The TWO YEAR ANNIVERSARY
Live at Wall High School, September 1
body_html:
The DRAFT
With every professional sports season precedes the annual draft – an array of determined individuals selected to a certain team. Though the beloved game of dodgeball is not on that mainstream level, the participants of the weekly gathering always act with class and style.

For this 101st outing, the wily veterans of yester-year combined forces with some of the newest, most talented warriors to ever set foot on the dodgeball battlegrounds. These very newbies added that element of surprise to already unpredictable clash, setting the stage for one of the closest encounters in all of history.

Team ONE Draft Picks (In Order of Selection):
1. Bobby Moser
3. Christian Prima
5. Robert Pellecchia
8. Robert Avakian
10. Kevin Adams
11. Dan Turner
12. Justin Dilts
15. Chris Adams
16. Gerald Lewis

Team TWO Draft Picks (In Order of Selection):
2. Mike Butler
4. Kevin Meinert
6. Paavo Prima
7. Ray Marzarella
9. Mike Edwards
13. Kevin Megill
14. Juan Londono
17. John Tronolone

And the rosters didn't stopped there.

Team ONE would acquire the likes of megastar Tom Adams, court general Justin Pierce, the sensational Lauren Stopa, and the debuts of athletes like Charles "Chicky" Surmonte and Jeff Mundo.

As Team ONE added to their all-star line-up, Team TWO would include the big-mouthed veteran Diana DiBuccio, dodging icon Sascha Basista, and the catching-machine himself, Mike "Sputz" Krott. Plus, the addition of new-comer Mike Miow gave this superb squad an extra edge.

The concept may have been one thought up at the very last minute, but there isn't any doubt or question that the Dodgeball Draft may come back for a second go. The score itself can certainly explain why:

Team ONE victories: 2, 4, 7, 8
Team TWO victories: 1, 3, 5, 6

It doesn't get any closer than this. And so in the absence of the anticipated CREAMation between legends Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick, it's safe to say the inaugural Dodgeball Draft delivered in high fashion.

Team ONE fought Team TWO to a 4 – 4 draw at DODGEBALL 101.

Moments & Stars: the swarm of bugs all over the court; the dominating performance from Lauren Stopa; Mike Miow's harding-hitting and ever-resilient debut

RECORDS
> Attendance: 30
> Notable Returns: Gerald Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LX3)
> New Players: (8) Bobby Moser, Mike Miow, Charles Surmonte, Justin Dilts, Christian Prima, Paavo Prima, Jeff Mundo, Kevin Meinert.

- With the super-sized Adams/Fitzpatrick rematch postponed, the sport witnessed the first-ever Dodgeball Draft where players were randomly put on either Teams ONE or TWO.
- DODGEBALL 101, along with the preceding DODGEBALL 100, are the first consecutive events with attendances of 30 or more since DODGEBALL 70 and DODGEBALL 71 in late December 2006/early January 2007, respectively.
- DODGEBALL 101 was the first event not to feature captains since DODGEBALL 97: Wall v. All 2.
- The famed OH Tracks soundtrack made a return, playing the songs that went unheard at the previous week's phenomenon, DODGEBALL 100.

DODGEBALL 102: The TWO YEAR ANNIVERSARY
Live at Wall High School, September 1
